message: I'm excited to offer you this unique product for $12,000. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really appreciate.
While I appreciate your offer, $12,000 is a bit out of my budget.  I'm willing to pay $8,500 for the product.  This is a fair price, as I'm sure you'll agree, given the value I'm placing on it.

I understand that $12,000 was a bit steep, but I was hoping you could meet me in the middle. I'm willing to compromise and sell the product to you for $11,000. It's a fair price, considering the value it holds for you.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $11,000 is still a bit high for me.  I'm happy to go up to $9,000.  This would be a great deal for both of us, allowing you to make a good profit while still being within my budget.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $9,000, but I'm not quite ready to accept that price yet. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $10,500. This is a fair price, considering the value it holds for you and the fact that you're already willing to pay more than the minimum you mentioned earlier.
